definition: to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
surname Xue
shame/disgrace
to take revenge and erase humiliation (idiom)

sentences.english: After ten years of careful preparations, he attacked and finally conquered the State of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 經過十年艱苦奮鬥，越過終於雪恥戰勝吳國。

sentences.english: He had seduced her to avenge his friend Greely.
sentences.chinese: 他佞媾了她，是要替他的朋友格利列雪恥。

sentences.english: To execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people.
sentences.chinese: 爲向異邦報仇雪恥，爲向列國進攻襲擊。

sentences.english: Today we're becoming sockets and strive to do better.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天要雪恥圖強，力爭做得更好。

sentences.english: His suffering is vindicated, and in Him, your suffering will be vindicated too.
sentences.chinese: 在他裏面，你的苦難也會得雪恥的。

sentences.english: It's a battle for fame, and especially for Milan it's the very chance to avenge a wrong and wipe out a humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 特別是對於我的米蘭，這是再好不過的報仇雪恥之際。

sentences.english: He cried to heaven for vengeance.

definition: to sacrifice one's life
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
nickname of Han dynasty general Li Guang 李廣|李广[Li3 Guang3]
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
iron hoof (of the oppressor)
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to die/to perish
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
glorious achievement (idiom)
to arouse dislike/to incur hatred
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
